com.mps.deepviolet.api

Interface IDVX509Certificate


  • public interface IDVX509Certificate
    DeepViolet X.509 certificate represenation. Most values come from an java.security.cert.X509Certificate instance upon initialization. However, some values are computed for convience like CERT_FINGERPRINT which represents the certificate fingerprint computed with the signing alorithm.
    Author:
    Milton Smith

      • getNotValidAfter

        java.lang.String getNotValidAfter()
        Certificate not valid after timestamp
        Returns:
        Timestamp certificate not valid after.

      • getValidityState

        int getValidityState()
        Certificate validity state.
        Returns:
        Validity state. Supported states, VALID_STATE_EXPIRED, certificate is expired. The certificate was once valid but no longer valid. VALID_STATE_NOT_YET_VALID, the certificate is not ready for use. VALID_STATE_VALID, certifidate ready for deployment and operations.

      • getSubjectDN

        java.lang.String getSubjectDN()
        Certificate Distinguished Name. Includes information that uniquely identifies the subject. Usually the subject is the host but could be other things in the future like code signer, etc.
        Returns:
        DN of the subject.

      • getIssuerDN

        java.lang.String getIssuerDN()
        Distinguished Name of the issuer. Includes information that uniquely identifies the issuing authority a Certificate Authority.
        Returns:
        DN of the issuer.

      • getCertificateFingerPrint

        java.lang.String getCertificateFingerPrint()
        Digital fingerprint of the certificate using the target algorithm identified by the certificate. For example, an MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256 hash.
        Returns:
        String representation of an octet sequence.

      • getTrustState

        int getTrustState()
        Trust state of the certificte.
        Returns:
        Supported states, TRUST_STATE_UNTRUSTED, certificate is not be trusted. TRUST_STATE_UNKNOWN, the trust state of the certificate cannot be determined. For example, if a certificate is being examined and the owning host cannot be determined or contacted. TRUST_STATE_TRUSTED, certificate has past trust certification process.

      • isSelfSignedCertificate

        boolean isSelfSignedCertificate()
        The signing authority is also the subject.
        Returns:
        true, if the subjectDN of the certificate equals the issuerDN.

      • isJavaRootCertificate

        boolean isJavaRootCertificate()
        The certificate traces back to active Java trust store. Usually, the default trust store and root Certificate Authorities that ship with Java. Note: roots change between different versions of Java. Oracle removes, adds, and updates roots regularly.
        Returns:
        true, the current certificate is a root in the active trust store. false, the current certificate is not a root in the active trust store.

      • getNonCritOIDProperties

        java.lang.String[] getNonCritOIDProperties()
        Non-critical OIDs.
        Returns:
        Property names of non-critical OIDs.

      • getNonCritPropertyValue

        java.lang.String getNonCritPropertyValue(java.lang.String key)

        Parameters:
        key - Key name of key/value pair.
        Returns:
        Property values for non-critical OIDs

      • isContainsNonCritPropertyKey

        boolean isContainsNonCritPropertyKey(java.lang.String key)
        Test for the presence of non-critical OID key names
        Parameters:
        key - Key name of key/value pair.
        Returns:
        true, key exists. false, key does not exist.

        Returns:
        true, key exists. false, key does not exist.

      • getCertificateChain

        IDVX509Certificate[] getCertificateChain()
                                  throws DVException
        Certificate chain of trust for the current certificate.
        Returns:
        Array of certificates chaining back to a root. Note: the certificates and root may or may not be trusted.
        Throws:
        DVException - Thrown on problems.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Representation of a certificate provided as key/value pairs. Order of the results are not guaranteed.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Enumerated key/value pairs representing this certificate instance.

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Test for equality. Two objects are considered equal if, 1) obj is an instance of IDVX509Certificate, 2) all key/value pairs are equal, 3) the length of obj.getPropertyNames().length()==this.getPropertyNames().length()
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object to compare
        Returns:
        true, obj and this are equal. false, obj and this are not equal
